|cpu1_cores = 1 |cpu1_type = MIPS 4Kc |cpu1_type_rev = (Little Endian) |cpu1spd = |is_doc = |bus = |flash1type = |fla1_num = |fla1chip = Spansion;S29GL032M90TAIR4; |flash1size = 4 |flash1maxsize = |ram1type = |ram1type1 = |ram1spd = |ram1size = 32 |ram1chip = ESMT;M12L128168A-7T; |ram1_num = 2 |nvramsize = |eth_cpu = true |lan_ports = 1 |lan_speed = 100MbE |ethstandard = |auto_mdix = |sup_jumbo = |ethoui = 00:11:95, 00:15:E9 |bootwait = |stockbootloader = ADMBoot;;; |stockos = Linux;2.4.18;5120-05; |exp_if_types = USB 2.0 |exp_usb_num = 2.0 |usb_hub = |pwr_volt_type = VDC |pwr_vdc = 5 |pwr_amp_dc = 2.5 |pwr_conn = barrel |pwr_barrel_outer = 5.5 |pwr_barrel_inner = 2.1 |pwr_barrel_len = 9.5 |pwr_pol = |serial = yes,, 4-pin header,, internal,, unpopulated,, 3.3V TTL,, (115200 8N1),, |jtag = yes,, 14-pin header,, unpopulated,, |specialfeat = |flags = |addchip = USB 2.0 Controller;NEC;µPD720101;NEC, JAPAN, D720101GJ, 0509PPA51;1; ,,, 5A Low Dropout Positive Voltage Regulator;AME;AME1084;;1; ,,, 1.5A CMOS LDO;AME;AME8815;;1; |802dot11_protocols = none |defaulip = 192.168.0.101 |defaultlogin = admin |defaultpass = |defaultssid = |defaultssid_regex = |default_ch = |manuf = Cellvision |manuf_model = |manuf_rev = |is_manuf = No |tpfirmware = OpenWrt |availability = Discontinued |eoldate = |fccapprovdate = |estreldate = 04/2005 |estprice = |upc = 790069270666 |ean = |dx_sku = |newegg = |asin = B0002Z45J0 |asin_country = US |asin2 = |asin_country2 = |countrymanuf = Taiwan |buttons = |led = |dimensions = |weight = }}{{TIDTOC|embedded}} ==Overview== "EPFS202UA020" and "FS202WU-1B0" is silkscreened on the board. :A date code of '''0517''' (April 2005) is also on the board. This device would seem to be a [http://web.archive.org/web/20060116103529/http://www.cellvision.net/product/file_server.htm '''Cellvision''' FS-202U] :(the FS-202WU [wireless capable] probably shared the same board). This device is listed on the [http://www.linux-mips.org/wiki/Adm5120_devices ''linux-mips'' ADM5120 device list]. In the absense of a DHCP server, the device will assume the IP of 192.168.0.101. ==Flashing== {{Flashnotice}} ===Flashing OpenWrt=== {{OpenWrtNotice|notrecommended}} {{OpenWrtNotice|insufficient}} {{OpenWrtNotice|endsupport|2022|19.07.10}} {{OpenWrt |techdata = https://openwrt.org/toh/hwdata/d-link/d-link_dns-120_a2 |wikipage = https://openwrt.org/toh/d-link/dns-120 |forumpage = |forumpage2 = |forumpage3 = |github = |target = |subtarget = |arch = |support_started_version = 10.03 |current_supported_version = 10.03 |unsupportedfuncntions = |comment = }} Please insert instructions here ==JTAG-Serial Info== ===Serial=== ====Serial Pinouts==== 
  °     °     °     °
(3.3) (TxD) (RxD) (GND) JP2

<--- LED ---> Screw + Board RSide edge
====Recovery via ADM Boot==== Hit the spacebar three times quickly after power-on - you can then transfer :a desired file to flash via [[wikipedia:XMODEM|XMODEM]] ([http://ttssh2.sourceforge.jp/ '''Tera Term'''] will work fine if you're :in [or have] a Windows environment to work with). [http://sitecom.nas-central.org/wiki/OpenWrt_on_the_LN-350] [http://www.nomissoft.com/files/cam_revival.pdf] [http://flyrouter.net/doku.php?id=midge:howto_5120] A successful recovery should look something like the following.. 
ADM Bootloader (v0.04.01 20040216)
==================================
(a) Download vmlinuz to flash ...
(b) Download vmlinuz to sdram (for debug) ...
(c) Update bootloader ...
(e) Exit

Please enter your key : a
Downloading..........PASS

Eraseing flash.......PASS

Programming flash....PASS
